intro: Lepicephalus leucanthemus, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, spiny stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its most striking feature is the showy, white to pale yellow flower head, which consists of many tiny florets arranged in a circular pattern. Lepicephalus leucanthemus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
